Could this be the long lost ship? If this proves to be the remnants of a wooden ship...on Mt. Ararat...what would be the argument against it being the one and only Noah's Ark described in the bible?
 
 http://abcnews.go.com/GMA/story?id=1727536&gma=true
 
 March 15, 2006- A satellite image may launch a scientific expedition to search for Noah's Ark. The snapshot captures a mysterious object on Turkey's Mount Ararat. 
 "I see for a 1,015 feet in length a shiplike object that has almost unbroken symmetry," said Porcher Taylor, an assistant professor at the University of Richmond.

Mr. Taylor isn't even an archeologist.
 
 A flood raising sea level more than two miles is ridiculous.

Could this be the long lost ship? If this proves to be the remnants of a wooden ship...on Mt. Ararat...what would be the argument against it being the one and only Noah's Ark described in the bible?
 

 
 The main argument would be that the earth was never covered with water in anything approaching modern times. It's more believable that someone carried the wood up there and built a boat that would never be used than that the earth was covered by 15000 feet of water without leaving any evidence.

Could this be the long lost ship? If this proves to be the remnants of a wooden ship...on Mt. Ararat...what would be the argument against it being the one and only Noah's Ark described in the bible?
 
 http://abcnews.go.com/GMA/story?id=1727536&gma=true
 
 March 15, 2006- A satellite image may launch a scientific expedition to search for Noah's Ark. The snapshot captures a mysterious object on Turkey's Mount Ararat. 
 "I see for a 1,015 feet in length a shiplike object that has almost unbroken symmetry," said Porcher Taylor, an assistant professor at the University of Richmond.

 
 
 And you know what I saw when I looked at that photo.
 
 I saw a ridge.
 
 If that turns out to be a 5000 year old wooden boat, I will go enroll at the local synaguge, and go to services every week.

I hope Porcher Taylor enjoys a good hike simply for the sake of exercise and his financial backers need a good tax write off ......
 
 Waxy

I think people will just look for anything in a picture. (About 2 years ago, this pregnant woman sent in a picture of a sonogram that she claimed looked like the face of Jesus to a radio station. One of the DJ's said the baby looked like Bob Seger.)
 
 Has anyone taken a good look at that picture sent in by the satellite? I can't see anything in that picture. For all I know, it's the surface of the moon or some canyon here on earth. I didn't see anything that resembles a boat at all.
Strange things happen but wood lasting for that long intact is unlikely

A huge wooden boat on the top of a mountain might have had some value as a source for christian mythology, but by now, after all those expeditions, after all those hoaxes, I'd sooner expect secret expeditions carrying huge amounts of fossilized wood and doing some shipbuilding.
 
 Heh, just the thing for Dan Brown to write about...

Heh, just the thing for Dan Brown to write about...

 
 To heck with Dan Brown, I should get crackin'!
 
 Definately the makings of a best seller there.
 
 Waxy
Have any fossils been found of the animals that went in there two by two?

the origin of the noah story comes from a series of flood stories that began with a disaster that affected the early civilizations of the sumerians. an essay on the historical and poleontological evidence for this is found here. in short, all the evidence suggests that there was never such a thing as noah's ark, and the flood was by no means global, nor was the earth under water for 3 years. we cant expect to find any ark remains on ararat mountain, because the survivors of the flood had nothing to do with that mountain

Where's that great article by that marine architect/engineer that said no wooden ship that large was even possible? I thought I read it in a thread here once. Something about "hogging" would cause the ship to break up.

Noah's Ark is a myth.

 Maybe.
 But so was Zeus, and you can still find remains of him in Greece.:p

Where's that great article by that marine architect/engineer that said no wooden ship that large was even possible? I thought I read it in a thread here once. Something about "hogging" would cause the ship to break up.
The ship was so large because Noah misunderstood the message and thought God said "cubed" instead of cubit. 
 Dono
Seems to me like that face the discovered on Mars. emoticon_wow
People can find a face or something significant in anything. That's a psycological thing. Maybe there should be a forum on here about psycological stuff.

Seems to me like that face the discovered on Mars. emoticon_wow

 
 Except that we can get to this mountain. Why is this even a controversy? Why hasn't someone just flown up there or climbed or something and actually taken a look? This spot can't be inaccesible, can it?
It isn't inaccessible. Expeditions have tried to search for the ark. Some have also found the ark, especially if they have brought one with themselves.

I would still like to know how anyone can see anything at all in that picture. It just looks like a cliff.
 As far as Noah's Ark itself...
 Now unless the boat was able to be kept preserved, a thousand years alone would cause the boat to decay and fall apart. Now if the story of Noah is true, then the boat would only need to stay together for long enough for Noah and his family and all the animals to survive the flood. Then what happens to the boat afterwords isn't really important.
